Shima City was born out of the merger of four districts in 2005. Shima is most famous for pearl cultivation and is a popular playground for watersports and holidaymakers.
Kintetsu Railway's Toba Line links Shima to
. Local trains and Limited Express trains are available (stopping at every station). Buses from
provide access to other areas of Shima. The last station on the line is

The best way to get around Shima is by bus or by taxi. Both can add up in the end, but there is also a car rental right next to Ugata Station. But depending on what you want to do the bus is probably the easiest and cheapest.

value: content=An ersatz Spanish "village" theme park and probably Shima's main attraction.
, very nice and very crowded beach 60 minutes bus ride from Ugata station.

content=Shima Marine land is a small marina located across the street from the Kashikojima train station. They have penguins, sea turtles, manta ray, and hundreds of types of fish. Compared to the aquarium in Toba it's nothing too special.
